v.v: They brought the sacred chest to Jerusalem and put it inside the sacred tent that David had told his workers to set up. Then they brought offerings to be completely burned on the altar and offerings to enable them to promise friendship with God.
When David had finished presenting all those offerings, he asked Yahweh to bless the people.
He gave a loaf of bread, some dates, and some raisins to every Israelite man and woman who was there.

Then David appointed some of the descendants of Levi to stand in front of the sacred tent in which the sacred chest had been placed, to lead the people who worshiped and thanked and praised Yahweh, the God of the Israelite people.

Asaph, who played the cymbals, was their leader. Zechariah was his assistant. The other descendants of Levi who helped Asaph were Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel. They played lyres and harps.
Benaiah and Jahaziel were priests who blew trumpets frequently in front of the sacred tent in which was the sacred chest.
On that day, David gave to Asaph and his helpers this psalm to praise Yahweh:
Thank Yahweh and pray to him.
Sing to him; sing songs to praise him.
Be glad that you belong to him.
Ask Yahweh to help you and give you his strength,
Do not forget the wonderful things that he has done,
We people are the descendants of his servant Jacob;
Yahweh is our God.
He never forgets the covenants that he has made;
That is the covenant that he made with Abraham,
It was an covenant for the Israelite people,
What he said was, “I will give the region of Canaan to you,
When Yahweh’s people were only a few in number,
they continued to wander from one place to another,
He did not allow others to oppress them,
“Do not harm the people whom I have chosen!
You people throughout the world, sing to Yahweh.
Tell among the nations that he is great;
Yahweh is great, and he deserves to be praised very much.
because all the gods that the other people groups worship are only idols,
God shows his splendor and majesty; they shine from where he rules.
You people in nations all over the world, praise Yahweh!
Praise Yahweh with the glory his name deserves.
Be very afraid in his presence, because he is good and powerful, completely different than you.
Everything in the sky and on the earth should be happy.
The oceans and all the creatures that are in the oceans should shout;
When they do that, it will be as though the trees in the forest will sing joyfully in front of Yahweh.
Thank Yahweh, because everything that he does is good.
Say to him, “God, you are the one who rescues us,
Praise Yahweh, the God of us Israelite people,

v: Tell the people of all nations what he has done.
Tell about all his miraculous deeds.
Those who want to know Yahweh better should rejoice.
and always seek to be with him!
the miracles and the just laws that he has decreed for us.
we are the people of Israel whom he has chosen.
His just laws are known by people throughout the world.
he made a promise that will last for a thousand generations.
and he repeated that covenant to Isaac.
and he wanted that covenant to endure forever.
to belong to you and your descendants forever.”
a tiny group of people who were living in that land like strangers,
from one kingdom to another.
and he warned kings by saying to them,
Do not harm my prophets!”
Every day proclaim to others that he has saved us.
tell all the people groups the marvelous things that he has done.
He should be revered more than all the gods,
but Yahweh is truly great; he created the skies.
Strength and beauty are in the place where he lives.
Praise Yahweh for his glorious power!
Come before him with offerings to give to him!
Bow down and worship Yahweh because he is holy and his holiness shines out from him with wonderful beauty.
He put the earth firmly in its place; and nothing ever will be able to move it.
People everywhere should say, “Yahweh is our king!”
the fields and everything that is in them should rejoice.
That will happen when he comes to judge everyone on the earth.
He faithfully loves us forever.
so gather us together and save us from the armies of other nations.
When you do that, we will thank you ,
and we will be happy to praise you.”
He has always existed, and he will exist forever.

v.v: Then David left Asaph and the other members of his clan there in front of the tent in which Yahweh’s sacred chest had been placed. He told them that they must do their work there every day.
David also left Obed Edom and 68 other descendants of Levi to work with them. Hosah and Obed Edom guarded the entrances of the sacred tent.

David also told Zadok the high priest and the other priests who worked with him to remain in front of Yahweh’s sacred tent, at the place where the Israelite people worshiped Yahweh there in the city of Gibeon.
Every morning and every evening they burned offerings on the altar, obeying the rules that had been written by Moses, rules that Yahweh had given to the Israelite people.
With them were Heman and Jeduthun and other descendants of Levi. They were chosen to sing songs to praise Yahweh because he faithfully loves his people forever.
Heman and Jeduthun were appointed to play the trumpets and cymbals when the other descendants of Levi sang sacred songs. The sons of Jeduthun were appointed to guard the gates of the sacred tent.
Then all the people left. They all returned to their homes, and David returned home to ask Yahweh to bless his family.
